column5: Thanks for further replies! The last few larger muskies have been surprises while trolling over deep water towards structure. Hmmm... maybe a new strategy.  There seems to be large fish in that huge northern main basin of Pigeon. Meely caught a bunch around 50" he posted this summer. Thanks again, ehg
Nice to see that everytime you hit that Lake there are some nice catches.  I guess I'll have to go grab that shad now!  Thanks
that 43 incher looks like it would eat you for lunch if you fell in the water lol

Hi folks, Had some time today so tried fishing Pigeon Lake. The bass seem to disappear from usual spots so walleye were targetted mostly on this fine fall day. It was real beautiful and quietish on the lake today. My buddy Dave was certainly happy to get out fishing.   Not much wind so vertical jigging for eyes seemed relaxing and the choice of day. Caught a bunch of smallish walleye this way.     None of these fish were very big but kept us busy catching and having fun. Dave says get the net but this one didn't turn out big either.  Were hitting these fish constantly was a gonna take a few home for eating but forgot to take any.  Caught some big colourful bluegill and rockbass as well.   Figured we would try trolling for muskies since might be last time up this way for the season. So i put on my trusty perch SuperShad Rap and buddy put on his favorite lure and trolling we went. Shortly into trolling while in middle of nowhere over 45' of water i got a hit. Turned out to be a chunky musky. Got it near the boat and it jumped and thrashed around.   Turned out to be a fat 43 inch fish.  Did get a picture with OFC sign for entry into tourney as well.  Didn't want to fish topwaters but with calm conditions tried anyways. Caught some little largies but didn't fish that way too long.   Turned out to be a real picturesque fall day with decent fishing, had a great time today. Too bad the days are shorter now it really flew by.  Cheers, ehg
Nice musky ehg, and on a super shad perch, cool.
Looked like a good full day of fishing, nice healthy Musky, well done...

Excellent report, fish, and pics ehg!!!  Those Pickerals look like small torpedos.  ... and that's a real nice 'Gill!!!  The Musky is a real Beauty!!!  ... I'd nearly give my left nad to catch one like that!!!  A very good day on the water for y'all, thanks for sharing that!!!
really enjoy your reports Erik thanks alot for sharring... geez you really love that sassy shad
Great report nice mix bag of fish beautiful musky you got  Rob
Great report and pics ehg  Looks like you guys found the hotspot for eyes and a very nice looking ski congrats  Thanks for sharing Leechman
nice looking musky! Very silver without too much markings (at least in the photo)
Rizzo  That's typical of suspended fish. Note that he caught it over 45' of water.  Nice muskie and a nice action shot!
What a day! Thanks for taking the time. Jim

Hahahaaa, Get the net!!! Get the net!!! That was great, always a good laugh on that boat. Im going out to buy the shad this week end, come hell or high water I get a musky next week. Those Walleyes were a blast, because there's always the possibility of a monster.
looks like a good day on the water
WOW...absolutely awesome ehg....what a great days fishing, that musky is great...caught so casually as well...lol. The weather looks great too. thanks for sharing.
Nice work dude and way to remember your tourney sign this time! More inches for the team!

Thats a great day to be on the water & the fishing was pretty good as well !!  !some decent fish,and that muskie is very nice & healthy too,some nice fish porn too !!!.  .gotta love those awesome fall warm fall days,thanks for sharing!!!...cheers
Nice stuff EGH.  Beauty muskie and a nice mix of everythign else too.
nice picture with the musky thrashing, that rapala lure sure has caught alot of musky for you. congrats.

Thanks for replies and happy thanksgiving! Certainly has been a beautiful weekend so far.   Thanks Mark, used those jig/sassy shad back in the CSF days, remember that... lol  Mike that is my oldest, most chewed up lure but it stll runs great and catches fish. I'll keep using it.  It was the quickest release of a fish for me. Couple quick pictures and it immediately took off once it hit the water. It was barely hooked.
Doesn't get much better than that.
Sweet report and great fish!  Great job out there man.  I'll update the team stats when I get the chance.....
hey nice report and pics.

WTG Eric, that's a nice fat fall musky.  There's been a few big fish, including a couple 50"ers come outta that deep section this year.  Sadly, this is the 1st year in a long time that I never fished Pigeon
great day on the water good to see some small eyes nice ski congrats
Now that's what we like to see! a nice variety of fish and one very possessed looking musky
Great report Erik.  That's a beauty muskie.  Those walleyes looks like they would have been alot of fun.  Jim
